reviews.review: Amazing storyline, great characters, outstanding gameplay. One of my favourites!

My girlfriend of the time dumped me round about the same time my best friend got me this game and I am so glad. Playing this helped me get through a tough time <3

Plus it helped me name my Gaming PC "Wheatley!"

Portal 2 is an amazing co-op game! I've played it with my friend and this is a great strategy game. I enjoy trying to solve the puzzle using the portal gun and move on to the next level! Great game. Still got a long way to the end though!
Worth the buy, especially for both games for £1.06

One of my favorite games ever played, the characters, the art, the mechanics! Portal is by far my most liked Valve game.

Ótima jogabilidade, tem algumas mecânicas bem melhores que o do primeiro (que também é um ótimo jogo por sinal) a história é bem feita e a gameplay  é fluida. Minha única reclamação é o fato de não ter legendas em português mas de resto tá perfeito
A great game with a good storyline and you can even make your own test chambers. I highly recommend this game.

[b]There still isn't any cake :\[/b]

You find yourself trapped in a room that seems to be associated with the same facility you tried to flee from. With the help of an [strike]little idiot[/strike] genius, you try to flee the facility again. After a long break of [REDACTED] Years, are you able to get out alive like you did before?

This game is a great sequel that ties in very well with the original Portal with improved music design, graphics (that crashed my computer twice forcing me to use the lowest graphics possible which still looks amazing) and the introduction of new mechanics like lasers, light beams and three new types of gels that helps you do  three different things, Jump Higher, Run Faster and Place Portals. With the returning face of GladOS and (spoilers) [spoiler]the unlikely team that the player and her make in the game[/spoiler], makes the game great with its twists and turns. The game also has a new character as mentioned earlier as that [strike]little idiot[/strike] genius, Wheatley. The combination of GladOS and Wheatley in the game makes a fun interactive  story driven game. Even if you finish the campaign, there is a [i]Co-op mode[/i] where you can play levels designed for two players with a stranger online or with a friend. This mode also has a neat little story. To top on that, the game also lets you [i]create your own[/i] Test Chambers that you can upload into the [i]Steam Workshop[/i] as well as play levels that are uploaded onto it.

I highly recommend this game for people who enjoy games with puzzles and a story and also people that enjoy playing puzzles from people and making them for others to play.
Best 1st Person Puzzle Game Ever made.

Everything.  The only thing wrong with this game, in my humble opinion, is that there isn't more of it.
That being said, there is the test chamber maker, which has lots more content.

Also, if you haven't played Portal Stories: Mel, do so.  Just do it, NOW... or you're FIRED!
Me gusto el rumbo que toma la historia y los giros inesperados con la que se desarrolla.
Love the humor, the puzzles are great.

The cake is still a lie.

By far, one of my favorite games ever. This sequel pays homage to the original while still being fresh and fun.

Good news is we've got a much better test for you: fighting an army of man-mantises. Pick up a set of foreleg spurs, mesothorax armor and tubercle sheaths. You'll know when the test starts." [/spoiler]

 - Cave Johnson
